getMultiColumnWizardValues.name: GetMultiColumnWizardValuesViewHelper
getMultiColumnWizardValues.documentation: ViewHelper for parsing the multicolumnwizard json string. Use this to prepare the data from a multicolumnwizard-field into an array. Examples ======== Field-data is found in: `data.multicolumnwizard` .. code-block:: html ` Content of `mcwArray`: .. code-block:: array(3) { 'field1' => 'value', 'field2' => 'value', 'field3' => 'value', } So it can be used like: .. code-block:: html {mcwArray.field1} Depending on the current value of `{data.multicolumnwizard}`.

associative.name: associative
associative.description: If the array should be associative

getSelectValues.name: GetSelectValuesViewHelper
getSelectValues.documentation: This ViewHelper call a function with given parameter.

configuration.name: configuration
configuration.description: The json string of the MultiColumnWizard field.

optionsFunction.name: optionsFunction
optionsFunction.description: This array has to contain the full classname, the method to call and all the parameter that are needed to call this method.

isEmpty.name: IsEmptyViewHelper
isEmpty.documentation:
Check if the given MultiColumnWizard field has any values.
Checks every filed in every row and returns true if every value is empty.

Examples
========

Usage in a condition like this: 

.. code-block:: html

  <f:if condition="!{mcw:isEmpty(json: data.multicolumnwizard)}"> ... YOUR CODE ... </f:if>
